sample_rows.claim_txt: 55. A terminal as claimed in claim 54, wherein said receiver is inactive between bursts.
56. A terminal as claimed in claim 54 or claim 55, wherein the controller is an ASIC.

1. A method for providing access communications between a customer premise equipment and a service edge, the method comprising: receiving from the customer premise equipment a communication according to a first time-division multiplexed signal format; converting the first communication to a carrier-tagged communication; sending the carrier-tagged communication as a packet-switched communication along a packet-switched communication path; converting the carrier-tagged communication to a second communication according to a second time-division multiplexed signal format; and sending the second communication to the service edge.
2. The method of claim 1 wherein the first time-division multiplexed signal format comprises a plesiochronous digital hierarchy signal format.
3. The method of claim 1 wherein the first time-division multiplexed signal format comprises a synchronous digital hierarchy signal format.
